content.vi:
Classic vs. Volume vs. Hybrid: Understanding the Basics

When booking an appointment at Nanky Beauty, you'll see three main categories: Classic, Volume, and Hybrid. Which one should you choose? It depends on the look you want to achieve and the health of your natural lashes.

1. Classic Lashes (1:1) - The "Mascara" Look

Classic is the most natural style, perfect for everyday wear.

  • Technique: One single extension is applied to one natural lash.
  • Effect: Adds length and curl, but keeps the volume natural. It looks like you have long, separated lashes with great mascara.
  • Best for: Clients with a good amount of natural lashes who want a subtle enhancement.

2. Volume Lashes (3D-6D) - The "Glam" Look

Volume is for those who want fluffiness, density, and a bit of drama.

  • Technique: Handmade fans of 2-6 ultra-fine extensions are applied to one natural lash.
  • Effect: Creates a dense, dark lash line and a fluffy, soft texture. Because the extensions are lighter, it's safe for most lashes.
  • Best for: Clients with sparse lashes (fills in gaps) or those who love a fuller, more glamorous look.

3. Hybrid Lashes (The Mix) - The "Textured" Look

Can't decide? Hybrid gives you the best of both worlds. Often called "Kim K" or "Wispy" style.

  • Technique: A strategic mix of 50% Classic and 50% Volume fans.
  • Effect: Provides the definition of Classic with the fluffiness of Volume. It creates a textured, non-uniform look that is very trendy.
  • Best for: Anyone wanting a bit more volume than Classic without the full density of Volume.

Summary
